Designed to be compatible with B/X D&D, and the various retro clones, Life of Rage requires the use of one of those core rules sets.

162699.name: Qruzlat: The Way of the Crushing Fist
162699.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the beginning, when Argok lead his people west, across the Dragonspine Mountains, he traveled with an advisor known as Tarok Bonecrusher. Tarok was a warrior without peer, believed to have even bested Argok himself in one-on-one combat. But what made Tarok unique was that he eschewed both armor and weapons, preferring to fight in only foreign robes, with fists and feet wrapped in leather...

Qruzlat is the orcish martial art developed by Tarok to harness the natural strength and rage of the orc. This supplement was written specifically for the Life of Rage - OSR Edition game, but can be used in a number of OGL-based systems.

162700.name: Hero's Journey
162700.description:
From publisher blurb:

What began as an attempt at yet another retro-clone, morphed into something altogether different. Included in this “alternate player’s guide” for Basic Era and compatible games, are alternate rules for classes, races, combat, and spell-casting. Technically speaking, this rules set includes everything you would need to play. However, your mileage may vary on that, and you may either import other rules, or cherry-pick what you like from here.

162701.name: Half-Orc Sorcerer
162701.description:
From publisher blurb:

While it is true that full-blooded orcs (and goblins) are unable to manipulate arcane energies, half-orcs, with their mixed heritage, have been known to manifest such abilities. However, because there are no schools of wizardry within the orcish lands, those that have the potential are left to piece the ability to cast magic together on their own. The end result is that these “sorcerers” are only able to master a few spells. These spells are fueled by the caster’s innate rage, and are often of a destructive nature.

162702.name: Lives of Kos
rpgsetting: Swords of Kos Fantasy Campaign Setting
162702.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Lives of Kos, the fifth volume of the highly-anticipated Swords of Kos Fantasy Campaign Setting! This book contains 115 system-free biographies of personages who live on the island of Kos or the lands surrounding it and are mentioned or appear as characters in the related sourcebooks or stories about the campaign setting. All of them can be used either individually or in conjunction with one another, and within the context of the Swords of Kos campaign setting or as part of any other milieu. This book follows Kos City, Kos Island, Lands Beyond Kos, and Encounters and is fully compatible with and expands upon concepts that appear in them.

The Swords of Kos Fantasy Campaign Setting has deliberately been designed to be system free, not tied to any particular game setting, and to be compatible with any set of role-playing game rules suitable for ancient, medieval, or fantasy venues. In that the setting was used as the playtest backdrop for games using the OGL/d20, Pathfinder, “Basic” Dungeons & Dragons and Labyrinth Lord retroclone, and Advanced Dungeons & Dragons rules, of course, it is an especially ideal setting for them.

162703.name: Naiad Class Grav Destroyer Escort
162703.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible vehicle. The vehicle introduced in this installment of the series is an ultra heavy TL10 Grav destroyer.

The PDF contains the background of the vehicle and statistics for its use as well as an illustration.

162704.name: Punk Rock Saves the World
rpgseries: Cartoon Action Hour Season 3 Series Book
162704.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this Cartoon Action Hour: Season 3 series book by Matt Forbeck, a punk rock band discovers a long-lost time machine that looks like a giant gramophone and ends up tumbling through the annals of time itself on one exciting misadventure after another. They'll face the villainous Thomas Edison, the Endless Elvises, The Man, a disco band led by a time-displaced Al Jolson and many other threats to the space-time continuum!

Setting information.
Write-ups and stats for 8 Game Master Characters, 2 types of Goons and 4 ready-to-play Player Characters.
Details for creating your own Player Characters, including a brand new Special Rule called "Concert".
A fun system for carrying out "battles of the bands" or simply swaying crowds with music.
A discussion about cartoon-ized punk rock.
Four episode seeds.

162705.name: The Wreck of the Tereshkova
162705.description:
From publisher blurb:

At the edge of the Outer Veil, a sun-drenched planet harbours a dark secret...

The FNH Tereshkova has gone missing on a routine survey mission. The players are needed to find out what happened to this survey ship. A|t the unnamed world they will have to explore the wreckage of the Tereshkova, searching for survivors. But what has the insidious atmopshere done to those pitifuly few survivors?

The Wreck of the Tereshkova is a complete adventure for the current edition of the Traveller SF RPG.

162706.name: The Astral Splendour
162706.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Astral Splendour - a beautiful new starship laden with passengers - begins her maiden voyage across the Outer Veil, but all is not as it seems…

The player characters are passengers or crew members on the Astral Splendour, a luxury liner built by United Starlift. The ship is the first of the type and is on her maiden voyage, having just completed shakedown cruises and certifications. She is making a run through several star systems, showing off the design and transporting passengers from the Core to the Frontier. She will then make a return journey by a different route before plying a fixed route of four to six worlds primarily within the Intermediate region.

The Astral Splendour is the first adventure for Spica Publishing's Outer Veil setting but could be set in any game universe with a little adjustment.

Inside you’ll find:

A guide to interstellar travel in the Outer Veil universe;
A collection of non-player characters for use in this adventure;
The Maiden Voyage of the Astral Splendour, a complete adventure, including:
Details of the Astral Splendour’s crew;
Full starship statistics and deckplans for the Astral Splendour.

162707.name: Through the Veil Part 1
162707.description:
From publisher blurb:

A free meal to listen to a job offer? That’s the best deal going right now...

The patron is the owner of a ship that just put into Marcos, and he’s hiring. He has a reputation for being a hard taskmaster but he knows his way around the frontier. Details of the job are sketchy but it’s posted as a long-duration cruise out to Coreward.

That’s a long way, even aboard a Jump 2 ship; on the other hand, it’s a job for the whole of that time…

162708.name: Through the Veil Part 2
162708.description:
From publisher blurb:

Something Rotting in the State of Denmark?

By the third day in jump, some of the crew notice something unpleasant. The owner wrinkles his nose occasionally, frowns in a puzzled manner and is seen looking or sniffing inside inspection hatches. By day five, there is a distinct stench in some parts of the ship...

162709.name: Through the Veil Part 3
162709.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Last Shining Light of Civilisation

As the ship settles onto the landing pad, the Captain reminds the crew that once they leave this system they will be headed out beyond ‘civilised’ space, so they should make the most of the world’s amenities. They have a week to find any cargo that they can, engage in speculative trade, get blind drunk, eat pseudosushi
or whatever else they want to do because, after that, they’ll be leaving the bright city lights behind for the Outer Veil and beyond...

162710.name: Through the Veil Part 4
162710.description:
From publisher blurb:

Incident at Al-Tawhid

Al-Tawhid is a dull sandy-brown colour when seen from orbit, with little radio traffic and few other signs of life. There are power signatures from one small area of the planet and not much else. The atmosphere aboard Naddod is one of rather less than excitement as the ship enters the atmosphere.

But that could change soon...

162711.name: Through the Veil Part 5
162711.description:
From publisher blurb:

Planetfall at NSSC 2314

Naddod emerges close to the mainworld, which is only a little more inviting than the previous one. At least this world has bright patches to break the monotony of dull rock. The ice fields are light gray except when direct sunlight hits them, when they glitter silver-white.

Old friends and a cold, harsh world await...

162712.name: Through the Veil Part 6
162712.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Uninhabited Garden World. What Could Possibly Go Wrong?..

The Naddod lands on the largely-unexplored garden world of NSSC 2111 where a walk through the forest for the space-weary crew is a chance to stretch their legs and breathe some real air for a change, and maybe take in the local wildlife.

Or maybe run from the local wildlife...

162713.name: Through the Veil Part 7
162713.description:
From publisher blurb:

Workin' in a Coal Mine, Goin' Down-down-down...

The Naddod lands on the rockball world world of Tootega where solving a problem in the local mine could lead to help for the Naddod's owner.

Just watch your vacc suit doesn't spring a leak down there...

162714.name: Through the Veil Part 8
162714.description:
From publisher blurb:

Low on Fuel and a Sick Man On Board...

The Naddod needs to refuel urgently, as her owner is getting sicker and weaker. But why would something be hidden in the system's gas giant, and why would the Naddod's owner send her onwards to a system with no refuelling facilities?

When you assume, you make an ass of you and me...

162715.name: Through the Veil Part 9
162715.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Old Friend or an Old Enemy?...

Time is running out for the Naddod's owner; he needs medical treatment urgently and there is someone who can help - but will he? Or will past problems prove too much to overcome?

The clock is ticking...

162716.name: Through the Veil Part 10
162716.description:
From publisher blurb:

A little wood cutting. What could possibly go wrong?

The Naddod arrives at NSSC 3009, where help is needed constructing the local dam. With modern technology available to help, what could possibly go wrong for the adventurers?

This last part the the Through the Veil series is dedicated to its originator, David Chase.

162717.description:
Gladiators is a tactical action game, where you play a gladiator fighting for Glory in ancient Rome. On each turn, players draw a small hand of Action cards and roll 5 custom dice. The symbols on the dice will shape what cards, gladiator skills and movements the player can make. The player with the most Glory at the end of the match wins.

The tactical decisions are simple but deep: how best to use you
positioning, cards and gladiator skills to maximize your Glory each turn. You also have to be aware of the NPC enemies, other players, and traps in the arena. Using the dangers of the arena to your advantage is key to your survival.

There are multiple match formats, including standard (anyone can attack anyone), coop, grudge match, and more. A single match takes around 30 minutes, but you can also play a full tournament. Tournaments are 3 matches in a row, tweaking decks between each match.

To win, players must pay attention to the crowd. A deck of Crowd cards provides new ways of earning Glory as the match goes on, and the rewards are often far higher than those for simply killing your foes. Completing special objectives earns you Crowd Favor, which is worth a huge chunk of Glory at the end of the match. Favor will go back and forth between players during a match, and it is often the favorite who ends up winning.

In the end, only Glory matters. Even if your gladiator dies, you can still win if you had a glorious death.
162717.name: Gladiators

162718.name: Convention Book: Void Engineers
162718.description:
From the Back of the Book:

The Few, the Proud, the Enlightened

The Void Engineers are hiding something. They've traded many of their ideals for guns, turned vessels of peaceful exploration into mobile defense platforms, and - most frightening to the Union - forged themselves into an organized military. They've kept the rest of the Technocracy grounded as they fight a mysterious war beyond the boundaries of Earth against adversaries too heinous to name.

As much as that's tearing the Technocratic Union apart, that's the only way it can be: only the Void Engineers can defend Consensual Reality from horrors beyond. For only they can stand before what lurks out there, hungry to return to Earth.

A World Under Siege

The world beyond Earth has changed much in fifteen years, and not just from the Dimensional Anomaly. The Engineers have been forced to adapt to a Void growing ever darker. Convention Book: Void Engineers updates Mage: the Ascension with fresh 21st century ideas of the starfaring Convention - once filled with hopeful explorers and rebellious dreamers, now scarred by their secret war.

162719.name: War Prime
162719.description:
War Prime is a sci-fi miniatures war game set in a distant future.

The human empire has explored the stars and taken thousands of systems as their own. But their expiation has made many enemies and their draconian rule has created unrest within their own boarders.

A terrible cosmic anomaly ripped its way though the human empire forcing those from the many planets in its path to evacuate, abandoning homes and resources. This disaster gives the Empire's enemies the opportunity they need to invade and drive the ruling aristocracy out of power. Earth has fallen and humanity is fractured.

The game of War Prime allows players to take up one of many sides in this galactic battle. The initial release of rules includes the divided Humans, the savage Kelk, and the mysterious Amerant.

162720.name: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season 2: Episode 2: A House Divided
videogameseries: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series
videogamecompilation: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season Two
162720.description:
User Summary

The Walking Dead: Season Two: Episode 2 is the continuation from the previous episode.

162721.name: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season 2: Episode 3: In Harm's Way
videogameseries: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series
videogamecompilation: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season Two
162721.description:
User Summary

The Walking Dead: Season Two: Episode 3 is the continuation from the previous episode.

rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
162722.name: System Book 2: Xibalba
162722.description:
From publisher blurb:

A body drifts in the vacuum of space near the ruins of a habitat, dimly illuminated by the cooling corpse of a star. Strange noises echo down empty corridors. Ghostly figures appear outside spaceship windows. Voices from the past and future call for help on the radio. Ships go missing without a trace in the darkness.

Are you brave enough to explore Xibalba?

Spica Publishing presents System Book 2: Xibalba - a complete planetary system around a white dwarf star compatible with the current edition of the Traveller or any other SF RPG, designed for use in an existing campaign or as the focal point of an adventure. Inexplicable events plague the inhabitants of the system - are they really haunted by the ghosts of the dead, or is there a more rational explanation for the manifestations?

162723.name: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season 2: Episode 4: Amid The Ruins
videogameseries: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series
videogamecompilation: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season Two
162723.description:
User Summary

The Walking Dead: Season Two: Episode 4 is the continuation from the previous episode.

162724.name: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season 2: Episode 5: No Going Back
videogameseries: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series
videogamecompilation: The Walking Dead: A TellTale Game Series - Season Two
162724.description:
User Summary

The Walking Dead: Season Two: Episode 5 is the continuation from the previous episode.

162725.name: Death of the Jabin Sagna
162725.description:
From publisher blurb:

As a pair of fresh faced adventurers yearning to show the world what you have you can almost taste the action, but you haven’t found any yet. While on the road a local farmer tells you that the Thorp of Templeton is looking for someone to find their missing ferryman. While the farmer doesn’t have many details the thorp in question is less than half a day’s walk from where you are. As you wander down the road with your friend you both revel in a job as easy as finding a drunken boat captain!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a dual initial adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

162726.name: Tales of Talingarde
162726.description:
From publisher blurb:

New Ways to be Wicked!

The critically acclaimed, ENnie-nomiated "Way of the Wicked" villainous adventure path continues in a seventh supplemental volume. New maps, new handouts, and new adventures allow for more fun being the bad guy than ever before.

Take a turn playing the minions of your wicked villains. Rise as the undead and play the campaign entirely as a coven of vampires. You’ll even discover a mad island-spanning ritual for utterly destroying the noble kingdom of Talingarde once and for all.

There will be no one to stop you this time!

Inside you’ll find:

“MinionQuest,” a three part darkly humorous adventure compatible with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game by Gary McBride
Full color illustrations, handouts and maps by Michael Clarke
A gazetteer for the town of Aldencross
Options for taking the campaign in exciting new directions
More fun with Grumblejack the ogre
And More!




Now you can be the villain like you’ve never been before!

162727.name: Victory through Industry
162727.description:
The Second World War is raging, and your industrial output is needed for the war effort. In Victory through Industry, you'll build a factory complex capable of manufacturing the products needed by our boys at the front, everything from battleships to canned food.

Over the course of the game, players build a network of factories that consume certain products as their inputs and produce others as their outputs. Players compete to win government contracts to be the exclusive supplier of particular products.

On your turn, you can consume products to build factories, use factories to produce different products, or pick up government contracts. Once you have a contract, you'll need to keep producing that product every few turns, or else you lose the contract and someone else can claim it.

162728.name: Reise durch Deutschland
162728.description: This is a simple roll and move game. The players start their journey in Berlin and end it in Hamburg. The first player to reach Hamburg winns the game. At the start of their journey, the players use one die. From space 50 on, they can use two dice.

162729.description:
This expansion includes two survivors and their Zombivor counterparts both designed by Lucio Parrillo.

Lucio Parrillo has worked for the most reputable companies in the comics and games industry over the last 15 years. His pencil illustrations for the American publisher ‘SQP’ are featured in ‘Vampire Girls’, ‘Coven 2’ and ‘Eternal Temptation’. He painted numerous covers, interior art, and character design for a great number of video games and role playing games such as ‘Forgotten Realms’, ‘Eberron’, ‘Magic’ and ‘Hecatomb’.

He’s illustrated dozens of cards seen in ‘Magic the Gathering’ and ‘Warcraft’, and executed interior illustrations for ‘Dungeons & Dragons’ and a number of comic books for ‘Magic the Gathering’ (Jace vs Chandra).

Lucio has worked for many European and American publishers in Germany, France, Italy, Sweden, and USA.

The two survivors include:

BROTHER MAX the MONK
"Blessed be the undead, for they have inherited the earth."

Brother Max’ monastery was destroyed during the zombie outbreak and the rampage that followed. Scrounging weapons from the rubble, he emerged for the first time in years to face the world. Brother Max views the zombie outbreak as the start of the Apocalypse and believes that the zombies are rising from the dead and are therefore holy. By blowing their heads off he is sending them to Heaven where they belong. Brother Max’ religious fervor makes him an excellent fighter, although his zeal to send as many zombies to Heaven as possible can be unnerving.

DONNA the FASHIONISTA
"At least I don’t have to worry about price tags anymore."

Donna has always had superior taste. Her sense of art, music, and especially clothing was far superior to more pedestrian intellects. Unfortunately, she had zero talent for craftsmanship. She had the eye, but the ability always eluded her. Still, she made a decent living as a consultant, especially for a number of B-grade martial arts films. She was on the set when the zombie apocalypse began, surrounded by elegant weapons. While Donna hasn’t quite gotten used to the grunge and squalor of Survivor living, she has found one bright side: She has her pick of clothes. The zombies are almost an aside when they stand between her and particularly elegant evening wear. Any Survivor groups are guaranteed to improve their image, just by having her around.
162729.name: Zombicide Special Guest Box: Lucio Parrillo

162730.name: The Great Knowledge Game of Ireland
162730.description: Its object is to provide a simple entertaining and educational game whereby knowledge of Ireland, her people, history, geography, arts, culture, ancient traditions and pastimes, sports, politics and much more may me acquired or exercised.

162732.name: Valiant Universe: The Roleplaying Game
162732.description:
From the publishers homepage:

Do You Have What It Takes?

No matter the powers, no matter the choices, the price in body and mind may be more than you’re willing to pay.

And your choices will lead to heroics…or to villainy. How will you be remembered?

The edge between superhero and villain has never been sharper. In the Valiant Universe RPG, players will immerse themselves in a dark and gritty world where every mission and every battle has deadly consequences. Whether playing X-O Manowar, Bloodshot, Shadowman or even the all-powerful Toyo Harada—or any of dozens of characters—Valiant’s most fearless heroes will unite for the first time in a roleplaying game, allowing you to join their stories and create new ones!

Whether you’re a longtime fan or brand new to the Valiant Universe, this is the only source you’ll need to bring Valiant’s leading characters to life in a fantastic superheroes setting!

This book includes:
•Cue System: The rules-light and easy to learn Cue System allows a novice or uninitiated RPG player to quickly get inside the head of their superhero and plunge into the action.
•Title Exposés: Detailed summaries of all the Valiant Universe comic titles allow players to easily determine which part of the universe they want to game in; a perfect companion to the Valiant Universe Handbook.
•Character Dossiers & Creation Rules: Along with ready-to-play missions, superhero and villain character Dossiers will have players in the thick of the action in no time. Or do you want to create your own superhero or villain and add it to the Valiant Universe pantheon? Quick and easy rules give you that freedom!

162734.name: Tactical Game 3
162734.description:
User Summary
This game was the precursor to PanzerBlitz. It was developed from two playest projects at Poultron Press, Highway 61 and State Farm 69. Tac Game 3 is the very first commercially available board wargame to depict modern ground combat at the tactical level. This two-player game pits German and Russian armoured forces against each other on the Eastern Front in 1944.

Sold by direct mail and advertised in S&T, not sold in boxed version.

162735.name: Atlantis: The Second Age (Second Edition)
162735.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Atlantis is a sword and sorcery game inspired by the works of Fritz Lieber, Michael Moorcock, Robert E. Howard, and Clark Ashton Smith.

Welcome to the world of Atlantis!

This is a new role-playing game for a new generation that draws inspiration from the material of the original. While staying true to the original setting, this all-new game expands upon it with a dynamic magic system, exotic technomantic magical creations, and rules to bring your character's back-story and drama to life at the table.

• Play as a twisted Netherman cannibal, a haughty Atlantean sorcerer, a bestial Anadaman thief, or a mercurial Jinn warrior.

• Face the horrors of the dark isle of Anostos, brave the fighting-pits of Atlantis, and battle Makara on the high seas.

• Uncover ancient conspiracies, cleave demented cultists, and conquer lands unseen by civilized man for a thousand years.

• Rebuild the might of shattered Atlantis, or wipe clean the past and create your own empire from the dust and blood of the lost age.

Will you be kingmaker, tyrant, thief, scholar, or slayer?

162736.name: Atlantis: Geographica
162736.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The Geographica is the first companion book for the role-playing game Atlantis: The Second Age. The Geographica details the people and culture of the antediluvian world once ruled by the kingdom of Atlantis.

Each continent is explained in great detail with colorful comments by the denizens that have lived or adventured there. With lavishly illustrated maps that include major cities, sites of ancient ruins, and plot hooks for the industrious game master, this book becomes an invaluable tool for player and GM alike.

162737.name: The Deer God
162737.description:
The Deer God is a 3d pixel art game about reincarnation.
The hunter becomes the deer, the deer the hunter.
Find others like you, discover new areas, avoid wilderness creatures, and search for hidden secrets.

Source: [crescentmoongames.com/wordpress/the-deer-god/ The Developer Website].

162738.description:
Overview:
Citizens of a high-tech metropolis demand the most modern commuter train system in the world! The mayor hires several companies to build the network as a joint project, including yours! Naturally, you’re trying to take the most credit for the network’s success. Complete routes with a variety of buildings to earn credit! Achieve your secret objectives to win extra credit at the end of the game. The player with the most credit wins!

How to Play:
Each player has their own personal color-coded deck of Rail Cards. Each Rail Card features two lines and two terminals in various combinations, thus all presenting six different outlets with varying connections or dead ends amongst them. Each card also features two different buildings, each situated on either of the two lines. (There are five different types of buildings.)

Players take turns laying down one card at a time, adjacent to existing cards, to build the map of the city. Cards must be placed in a "brick" pattern. If placed so that the short sides are adjacent to one another, the cards must be in a straight line. However, if placed so that the long sides are adjacent to one another, the cards must be off-set. In this manner, a single card may have up to six adjacent cards.

There is another limit to placement: Cards may not be placed outside of the city limits. This is a final shape of the city determined by the number of players. Though you know what shape the city will take at the end of the game, there is no "board" which predefines the "center" of the city. The city grows and shifts with each new card played. Controlling the growth and logic of the city is fundamental to strategic play.

Scoring and Victory:
Score score "credit" by having the most segments of your color comprising a complete route. A route is complete when it is capped at both ends by a terminal or when it is made into a loop. Score 1 credit for each different type of building on a complete route. Extra credits may be scored by completing secret objectives, most of which require the city to meet certain configurations.
162738.name: Light Rail
boardgamefamily: Guild: Game Designers of North Carolina

162739.name: Gauntlet: Operation Pedestal, August 11-13, 1942
162739.description:
Gauntlet is a two player game on the epic naval and air battles for the largest Malta relief convoy of World War II (although solitaire play is easy to do). In August the Malta garrison was on the ropes, with critical supplies nearly exhausted. Allied forces were in full retreat towards Egypt following their defeat in the Gazala Campaign. The Axis forces realized the Pedestal Convoy could very well be the battle for "all the marbles" and mobilized tremendous air, submarine and surface fleet assets to contest its passage. The Allied convoy was savaged but enough ships made it through, including the tanker Ohio whose ordeal was a true epic of wartime heroism, to enable Malta to hold out.

Can you do better?

162740.name: The Games of the Goddess
boardgameimplementation: Life on the Farm Board Game
162740.description:
About the Game:

This game is an abstract game designed, created and published by me, Magdala Ramirez. Games people Play is a board game that dares you to go on a quest within the self to uncover your spiritual path. It will take you into the cycles that you encounter in your life and help you to understand how you have evolved. In this world of duality, the system created separation and disconnection within the people. It happened over and over again. Soon, people stopped be-living in themselves and an inner battle began. Chaos, destruction and sadness came into being in the outside world as the human beings became more disconnected and dysfunctional within themselves. Human beings got caught in the cycles that created turmoil within them and peace was no where to be found, until now. Now the human beings are ready to reach themselves by embracing and uncovering the cycles within the self. They are ready to integrate their hearts and birth a higher perception of themselves.

How to Play :

This is an ancient game of serpents and arrows. The arrows make your energy go up and the serpents take your energy down.

Role a dice and use your marker to move across the board. Read about the number you land on and meditate why you are there and where you are going, and where the synchronicity of the dice will take you. You can start if you throw a one on your dice. Then, the game begins! Use as a board marker something personal that has your energy. It could be a ring, a stone, a crystal etc. As you proceed in the game, you are led to different houses and the meaning of each house that you enter into during the game is written in the book that comes with the game.

You win when you became a God-Goddess, the number 68, having perfect control of yourself and using your feminine power with all its divine implications. Meditate on this. Meditate in your circle. You will find this game a beautiful tool to knowing yourself.

162741.description:
A new mini-expansion that is part of the Everything Alhambra Kickstarter Campaign.

Contents: 9 tiles.

Setup: All nine tiles are added to the bag along with the rest of the building tiles

Rules: At the end of each round, the Medina tiles are scored after all other buildings have been scored. Negative points are awarded to the player or players who has the least Medinas built.

In the first round it is the player with the least (-3 pts)
Second round the two players with the least (-3 pts, -6 pts)
Third round the three players with the least (-3 pts, -6pts, -9 pts)

Ties are resolved by the Medina who has the higher purchase prize wins the tie, thus the player with the cheaper Medina gains the high minus points

In all scoring rounds, every player who has not built any Medina tiles receives additional minus points equal to the round you are scoring.
162741.name: Alhambra: Medina Buildings

162742.name: Cubit (1983)
162742.description:
User Summary

Change the color of the blocks by jumping on them in this Q*Bert clone.

162743.name: Transatlantic Terror
162743.description:
From the Introduction and Keeper's Information section:

On a trip on the fast and luxurious RMS Adriatic from New York to Dublin the Investigators have the chance to rub shoulders with the great and the good of transatlantic society. The joyful occasion of a wedding on board is interrupted by some strange behaviour. Can the investigators uncover the threat in time, or will they be shadowed by a well-protected foe?

This short adventure can be slotted into many of the other Age of Cthulhu adventures, and features deck plans and details of ship-board activities.

Available as a bonus adventure to Kickstarter supporters of Age of Cthulhu 8: Starfall Over the Plateau of Leng.

162744.description: This is the blood splattered, full game follow up to BN1. Up to 5 survivors must take on the might of the evil zombie player and stop Brighton being overrun by the dead. With weapons ranging from flamethrowers to sticks of rock, equipment ranging from bin armour to binoculars and encounters ranging from trapped survivors to passing samba bands, ZomBN1 takes in the breadth and scope of Brighton and bites it sharply in the jugular.
162744.name: ZomBN1: A Board Game all About Zombie Infested Brighton

162745.name: Tactics
162745.description:
This is a symmetric two player abstract which is played with (initially) 8 pieces per side on an 8x8 board. There are initially 3 types of piece: CROIX, which can move any distance orthogonally, IXI which can move any distance diagonally and ETOILE which can move any distance orthogonally or diagonally. All these pieces have a STOP piece of the opposing colour on their reverse side.
Pieces capture by either:
1). Moving such that enemy pieces are immediately (no gaps) orthogonally between them and friendly piece(s) or
2). Moving into a space immediately between two or more orthoganally seperated ememy pieces.
The captured piece(s) are turned over and become immobile STOP pieces for the capturer that in turn may be used in future captures. If recaptured the STOP pieces revert to their original piece.
The winner is the player who captures all the opponent's pieces or immobilizes all opponent's remaining pieces.

162746.name: Dania 1945
162746.description:
Dania 1945 (Denmark 1945) focuses on a fictional operation, "Cauldron" - allied airborne attack on Denmark in April 1945.

The game is an expansion of Arnhem 1944 and uses counters from this game. It contains a map of Denmark and areas nearby.

It was included in Taktyka i Strategia.

162747.description:
Will you accept this quest?
Brave adventurers sought! Travel into the depths of the Minotaur's labyrinth to bring back rare ancient treasures. Be light-footed and use your torches carefully. Steal as much treasure as you can and find the exits to escape to the surface. If you survive you will be immortalized in the roll of bravery forever.

Each player has entered the minotaur's labyrinth to try and gather as much treasure as possible while paying close attention to the correct paths in order escape the changing labyrinth. A player's turn consists of 2 phases: the Player phase and the Minotaur phase. During the Player phase, the player can play cards to perform actions or attempt to escape by matching the labyrinth paths explored with the exit cards. Then during the Minotaur phase, the minotaur will move towards the player depending on how much noise the player made in that turn.

Some of the available actions available are:
Move : explore a new room
Search: search the current location for treasure
Use Items: to perform certain actions

The game ends when all players have either escaped or been captured. The player who escapes with the most treasure is the winner.

The base game will come with several scenarios.
162747.name: Minotaur Max

162748.name: Broken Contract: Deep Underground
162748.description: Broken Contract is a miniature adventure board game for 2-8 players. Indentured mine workers in a distant future rise up against the hired security forces of their corporate overlords and attempt to flee the mines. Each player controls one or more characters in a high tension escape attempt or in hot pursuit of the fleeing miners. Elements of RPGs, board games, and miniature wargames are blended together to give you high adventure without heavy overly detailed mechanics.

162749.name: Kromore Roleplaying Game
162749.description:
Publishers Blurb:

Fantasy, medieval, steampunk, or futuristic... The choice is yours

Kromore's current timeline spans ten thousand years. Any of these times are available and all of them include expansive maps and setting information. We know gaming groups like the feel of a living world and we've done just that by giving them a place where their early era campaigns can directly impact their later era ones. If you like time travel you're in luck, Kromore is just the game you are looking for as everything is balanced and seamless between eras including gear and weapons.

162750.name: Storyteller Screen
162750.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This 2 sided Story Teller Screen is great for quick referencing Kromore game rules and information as well as hiding vital Storyteller materials from players wandering eyes. No Kromore Storyteller should be without!

162751.name: Kromore Exclusive Dice set
162751.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Custom Chessex Dice are uniquely cut with Kromore symbols on the D6 and D10 dice. These are a one of a kind and rare item we stocked from our Kickstarter and will never again offer them when they are sold out.

4 d4 die
1 d6 die w/ custom engraving
1 d8 die
1 d10 die w/ custom engraving
1 plastic case

162752.name: Kromore Loot Cards
162752.description:
Publisher Blurb:

54 Loot card set offers unique loot gear from Kromore's many eras. These cards are great for rewarding players with random loot and era specific items. The physical set comes complete with a plastic hard case to store your cards.

162753.name: Tears of the Fallen
162753.description:
Publisher Blurb:

80 page PDF module for the Tears of the Fallen Adventure.
This adventure brings characters through countless locations on Kromore and is great for levels 1-10.

Kromore Module for 1-5 players
PDF Edition
Levels 1-10 characters
Multi-Era Compatible
80 pages
Includes Maps, Charts, and Unique Gear

162754.name: Walküre
162754.description:
WEB OFICIAL

Walküre es un juego de ciencia ficción transhumanista, realista y duro, que parte de una elaborada historia contrafactual que se desarrolla a partir de un desenlace alternativo, pero plausible, de la Segunda Guerra Mundial.

Nuestros jugadores se verán envueltos en las intrigas, luchas y refriegas de un mundo dividido en bloques, inmerso en una Guerra Fría que se debate tanto en la Tierra como en el espacio, con la Humanidad lanzada a la exploración y colonización del Sistema Solar.

Walküre emplea un novedoso sistema derivado del conocido Cacería de Bichos (CdB), con un renovado algoritmo basado en tiradas de dados de seis caras y cambios sustanciales para adecuar el mismo a la idiosincrasia propia de la ambientación.


PUBLISHER BLURB

Walküre is a transhumanist science fiction game, realistic and hard, that part of an elaborate counterfactual story that unfolds from an alternative outcome, but plausible, the Second World War.

Our players will be involved in intrigue, battles and skirmishes of a world divided into blocks, immersed in a Cold War that debate both on Earth and in space, with Humanity launched the exploration and colonization of the solar system.

Walküre employs a novel system derived from known Bug Hunt (CdB), with renovated algorithm based on runs of six-sided dice and substantial changes to adapt it to the idiosyncrasies of the setting.

162755.name: Davey's Mystery
162755.description:
Davey's Mystery is an adventure puzzle game in the tradition of classic point and click titles. You begin being given the rights to a property from a man you never knew and proceed to explore the grounds unknowing what you will find.

Source: The Developer Website.

162756.name: Triviata the Opera Trivia Game
162756.description:
From the instructions:

OBJECT OF THE GAME: To answer opera questions in six categories, then move your token to Valhalla for a chance to win the game."

My recap: One player rolls the die, moves his pawn and answers the appropriate opera question from a card read by his opponent.

Questions are in the following six categories:

Lives of Opera Composers
Female Singers
Male Singers (and a Few Conductors)
Music, Characters & Plots--Questions about the Opera
Opera Companies
The Media--Recordings, Quotes, Films, Plot Sources

If the question is answered correctly, the player rolls and moves again to another question. If answered incorrectly, play moves to the left.

To win, answer a question correctly in each of six categories, move to Valhalla by exact roll of the die, answer one last question in the category picked by the the opponents.

Sounds like Trivial Pursuit for the Opera buff.

Contains 6 pawns, one die, score pad, trivia cards, roll-up board and the rules.

162757.name: Sunny Southern Shores
162757.description:
From publisher blurb:

AaWBlog Presents gathers together the great daily content posted on the AdventureAWeek.com blog; the Wonders of NaeraCull series of PDFs are built as travel brochures that highlight the dangerous Hungering Jungle of Aventyr, making a convenient FREE product that promises to be a great resource for GMs of all kinds.

Included in the Wonders of NaeraCull Brochure #1: Sunny Southern Shores you'll find...

an encounter with the loyal undead canines of the dread pirate, the Red Death
a horrifying new monster in the surf, the tide of the undead




the seadog's eyepatch, a new magic item ideal for any sailor

a new trap, the pirate triggersling
spectacle of the Red Death, an unsettling new haunt
the Rest of the Red Death, a truly memorable story locale!




Keep an eye out the rest of this month as we release a PDF at the end of each week detailing different areas of the Hungering Jungle, welcoming players and GMs alike to NaeraCull and the rest of Aventyr!

162758.name: The Mist Shrouded Vale
162758.description:
From publisher blurb:

AaWBlog Presents gathers together the great daily content posted on the AdventureAWeek.com blog; the Wonders of NaeraCull series of PDFs are built as travel brochures that highlight the dangerous Hungering Jungle of Aventyr, making a convenient FREE product that promises to be a great resource for GMs of all kinds.

Included in the Wonders of NaeraCull Brochure #2: The Mist Shrouded Vale you'll find...

an encounter with an unruly water elemental
a capricious new creature, the waterfall nymph!
a new magic item, the god tear pearl!
Of Water & Stone, a dangerous new trap!
a most unusual haunt, the queen's passage!
a new story locale, the God Tears Fall and enigmatic Green Spire!




Keep an eye out the rest of this month as we release a PDF at the end of each week detailing different areas of the Hungering Jungle, welcoming players and GMs alike to NaeraCull and the rest of Aventyr!

162759.name: SoB Stories #1: This Town is Gonna Kill Me
162759.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Y’know, I didn’t really understand what folks meant when they said no good deed goes unpunished, until I heard the story of Dory Brooker. You familiar? Aw shit then, pull up a chair. C’mon, buy me a round and I’ll fill your ears with one helluva tale.”

One year ago, a well-meaning citizen talked a mild-mannered accountant out of throwing herself off the roof of her apartment building. When that same citizen goes missing, the accountant looks for help in finding the man—not knowing just how many people want her savior to disappear for good.

This PDF is a standalone scenario for use as a one-shot or to placed inside your ongoing Streets of Bedlam campaign.

162760.name: Intriguing Lingo: The Language of Espionage
162760.description:
From publisher blurb:

Crawling through dungeons and slaying evil wizards is a hoot, and someone’s got to do it, but nothing gets your PCs as excited as intrigue, espionage, spying and spy-hunting. Give your PCs a chance to walk coolly into a room and declare, “My name is Proudfoot…Tallfellow Proudfoot.”

Intriguing Lingo introduces us to the language of espionage, so our intriguing NPCs can speak with authenticity. Whether we use modules or create our own fantasy world, this ebook will make it easy and fun to add intrigue to our fantasy roleplaying campaign.

Section 1 of this ebook answers the questions:

Why would we want to add intrigue to your campaign?
How do we get started adding intrigue?
Does intrigue in a fantasy setting necessarily use magic?




Section 2 introduces us to the words and phrases used by spies and spy agencies in a fantasy setting.

162761.name: Intriguing NPCs #1
162761.description:
From publisher blurb:

Crawling through dungeons and slaying evil wizards is a hoot...and someone’s got to do it, but nothing gets your PCs as excited as intrigue, espionage, spying and spy-hunting. Give your PCs a chance to walk coolly into a room and declare, “My name is Tinkerson…Mario Tinkerson.”

Intriguing NPCs #1 will introduce you to two NPCs up to their eyeballs in secret missions. Whether you use modules or create your own fantasy world, this ebook will make it easy and fun to add intrigue to your fantasy roleplaying campaign.

Section 1 of this ebook answers the questions:

Why would we want to add intrigue to your campaign?...and
How do we get started adding intrigue?




Section 2 introduces us to Madeline, the young heir to a throne…in hiding.

Section 3 presents a disgraced mage who needs help to find justice.

For each of these NPCs, I give you:

Their history and their current situation
Their long term goals and their quirks
Advice on adapting these NPCs to your game
How to use the NPC:
As a resource for your PCs
As a traveling companion
As a patron for your PCs
As an enemy

A list of ways your PCs could meet this intriguing NPC and missions they might send your PCs on
A quote from the NPC, to help you further understand their character.

162762.name: Intriguing NPCs #2
162762.description:
From publisher blurb:

Crawling through dungeons and slaying evil wizards is a hoot...and someone’s got to do it, but nothing gets your PCs as excited as intrigue, espionage, spying and spy-hunting. Give your PCs a chance to walk coolly into a room and declare, “My name is Goblinkiller…Grog Goblinkiller.”

Intriguing NPCs #2 will introduce you to two NPCs up to their eyeballs in secret missions. Whether you use modules or create your own fantasy world, this ebook will make it easy and fun to add intrigue to your fantasy roleplaying campaign.

Section 1 of this ebook answers the questions:

Why would we want to add intrigue to your campaign?...and
How do we get started adding intrigue?




Section 2 introduces us to the Dwarvish King’s enigmatic spymaster.

Section 3 presents a rather unique professional acquirer.

For each of these NPCs, I give you:

Their history and their current situation
Their long term goals and their quirks
Advice on adapting these NPCs to your game
How to use the NPC:
As a resource for your PCs
As a traveling companion
As a patron for your PCs
As an enemy

A list of ways your PCs could meet this intriguing NPC and missions they might send your PCs on
A quote from the NPC, to help you further understand their character.

162763.name: Intriguing NPCs #3
162763.description:
From publisher blurb:

Crawling through dungeons and slaying evil wizards is a hoot...and someone’s got to do it, but nothing gets your PCs as excited as intrigue, espionage, spying and spy-hunting. Give your PCs a chance to walk coolly into a room and declare, “My name is Elf-friend…Evangelina Emoria Elf-friend.”

Intriguing NPCs #3 will introduce you to two NPCs up to their eyeballs in in secrets and secret missions. Whether you use modules or create your own fantasy world, this ebook will make it easy and fun to add intrigue to your fantasy roleplaying campaign.

Section 1 of this ebook answers the questions:

Why would we want to add intrigue to your campaign?...and
How do we get started adding intrigue?




Section 2 introduces us to a woman who is the leader of a monastic order of women teachers…and a spymaster.

Section 3 presents a somewhat saintly mediator…who has a habit of getting into trouble.

For each of these NPCs, I give you:

Their history and their current situation
Their long term goals and their quirks
Advice on adapting these NPCs to your game
How to use the NPC:
As a resource for your PCs
As a traveling companion
As a patron for your PCs
As an enemy

A list of ways your PCs could meet this intriguing NPC and missions they might send your PCs on
A quote from the NPC, to help you further understand their character.

rpgitemversion: East Texas University Edizione Italiana PDF version
162764.name: East Texas University
162764.description:
From publisher blurb:

Study. Party. Save the World.

East Texas University promises prestigious leadership, connected alumnae, the fantastic Southern climate of Pinebox, Texas…and annoying roommates, professors that try to kill you (literally), and things that go bump in the night. Enroll at your own risk.

East Texas University offers a well-rounded syllabus of character creation, new Edges & Hindrances, gear, Setting Rules, and tours of campus and nearby Pinebox, Texas. For advanced credit, read the section on rituals and talismans. Finally, the Adventure Generator and encyclopedia of miscreants is sure to light a creative spark in even the most humorless campus parking enforcement officer. There are generator mechanics for parties and adventures as well as Ritual failure and a little thing we like to call “High Strangeness.”

Can you survive four years of college?

162765.name: East Texas University Archetypes
162765.description:
From publisher blurb:

Class is in Session!

East Texas University Archetypes provides the busy Dean with twelve full-color, full-page, ready-to-play archetypes, which may be used with the East Texas University miniatures (available at www.peginc.com) or with the enclosed Figure Flats!

Archetypes include: Sorority Sister, Cheerleader, Rodeo Queen, Activist, Geek, Wild Child, Fraternity Brother, Jock, Local, Student, Gamer, and Journalist.

Can you survive four years of college?

162766.name: East Texas University Player's Guide
162766.description:
From publisher blurb:

Study. Party. Save the World.

East Texas University promises prestigious leadership, connected alumnae, the fantastic Southern climate of Pinebox, Texas…and annoying roommates, professors that try to kill you (literally), and things that go bump in the night. Enroll at your own risk.

This is the information from the Player's Section of the [East Texas University] rulebook.

Pinnacle Entertainment Group grants the Game Master a “site license” to print this document for each player in her personal game. No electronic transfer of this document is intended or implied. The East Texas University Player’s Guide is for players only. The Dean (GM) needs the complete version of East Texas University.

162767.name: Degrees of Horror
rpghonor: 2015 ENnie for Best Adventure - Nominee
162767.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your boyfriend dumped you.

You’ve got exams first thing in the morning.

And the world's going to end at midnight unless you stop it.

Looks like another all-nighter with the study group.

Degrees of Horror features a full-length Plot Point Campaign that takes the students from Freshman to Senior, and uncovers a mystery as old as the faculty themselves. The syllabus includes classroom intrigue, dark conspiracy, dusty mysteries from the past, killer exams, massive parties, and new horrors to torment the student body.

Degrees of Horror also includes a full course-load of Savage Tales that work equally well with the Plot Point Campaign or your own epic saga.

Degrees of Horror is a Plot Point Campaign for East Texas University.

162768.name: Pinebox Businesses
162768.description:
From publisher blurb:

Small town America or that trendy strip right off campus, this versatile map offers a variety of businesses and street area to inspire the Game Master! Included are a coffeehouse/internet café, restaurant, convenience store, bar, specialty retail, and pawn shop/bank.

This map may be used with any of the other East Texas University maps to create more play area: Classrooms, Library, or Off Campus Housing.

This PDF offers options to scale and print only the sections you need, or print them all to create your own map!

162769.name: Off Campus Housing
162769.description:
From publisher blurb:

This versatile map offers two modern houses with very different floorplans to inspire Game Masters. One house has a master bedroom, three smaller bedrooms, and plenty of dining and living space—just like a grad student might share or professor might own for their growing family. The other house has three bedrooms, a study area…and bar, pool table, and hot tub—perfect for a fraternity house or that hip professor.

This map may be used with any of the other East Texas University maps to create more play area: Classrooms, Library, or Pinebox Businesses.

This PDF offers options to scale and print only the sections you need, or print them all to create your own map!

162770.name: Library
162770.description:
From publisher blurb:

This versatile library map offers bookshelves, computer workstations, conference rooms, and other interior fixtures give the Game Master plenty of space to run an epic battle—or take the action outside to the courtyard! This map may be used with any of the other East Texas University maps to create more play area: Classrooms, Off Campus Housing, or Pinebox Businesses.

This PDF offers options to scale and print only the sections you need, or print them all to create your own map!

162771.name: Classrooms
162771.description:
From publisher blurb:

This versatile map offers several classrooms, conference rooms, computer workstations, lobby, and other interior fixtures to give the Game Master plenty of space to run an epic battle—or take the action outside to the fountain or courtyard! This map may be used with any of the other East Texas University maps to create more play area: Library, Off Campus Housing, or Pinebox Businesses.

This PDF offers options to scale and print only the sections you need, or print them all to create your own map!

162772.name: Heritage of the Egyptian Gods
162772.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unlock a New Kind of Mythic Power!

Sure, your character’s mythic path tells you about the kinds of abilities in which he specializes, and perhaps even gives some clue as to his ultimate mythic destiny, but it doesn’t say anything about where he came from, and what made him mythic in the first place. For that, you can turn to a mythic heritage. This new aspect of mythic rules allows for further customization of your mythic character. A mythic character can choose a mythic heritage in addition to his or her mythic path, and doing so grants him access to a number of unique abilities that are designed to reflect the flavor of his heritage, while also being of value to characters of every mythic path.

This book centers on the heritage of the Egyptian gods, which represents characters whose mythic power comes from one or more of the deities in that ancient and mysterious pantheon. Characters with this mythic heritage can gain abilities associated with any of the ten deities in the pantheon, and each deity has three such path abilities, for a total selection of no less than 30 mythic abilities. Bend others to your will with the power of Horus, god of the pharaohs. Destroy undead abominations with the power of Osiris, god of the underworld. Blind your enemies with your radiance using the power of Ra, god of the sun. All this power, and more, can be yours to command.

162773.name: Henchmen for Hire
162773.description:
From publisher blurb:

More Than Just a Torch-bearer!

With Henchmen for Hire you breathe life into the hirelings and henchmen in your Labyrinth Lord campaign! Detailed information will provide gamers with information on developing these tried and true servants into sidekicks worthy of any hearty adventurer! Whether you're feasting on the fine meals of your halfling henchman or taken up a risky proposition of hiring a goblin wolf-rider, with Henchmen for Hire, you'll bring more than just another meat shield down into the dungeon!

These eight NPC classes are designed specifically to help offer expanded abilities to retainers, hirelings and henchmen without overshadowing the player characters who hire them. From the loyal sword of a squire to the gentle touch of an acolyte, every adventuring party will find allies worthy of their coin who are ready to brave the greatest dangers of the wilderness - provided the price is right.

162774.name: Hull Down
162774.description: Hull Down is a modern tank-to-tank combat game which is produced as a professional, wholesaled item. (Review in Strategy & Tactics Magazine, Vol. III, No. 1)

162775.name: Arbela
162775.description: Arbela is an Avalon Hill-type of game set in the ancient period of combat. (Summary from Strategy & Tactics Magazine, Vol. III No. 1)

162776.name: The Pomors
162776.description:
The Pomors are the people, who live on the coast of the White sea, or how it was called in the past, Mare Album in the North of Russia. You take the role of brave fishermen, who send their ships to fish and to hunt marine animals at the White sea. You have information about fish stocks, you should wisely use it and send your ships to the best fishing places. You can also try to get ahead of your rivals, by going further than any other into the sea and getting the biggest catch. But don’t forget, that sea weather often changes and the storm can cause damage to your ship!
Moreover, in those old times, the only way to keep the catch was to salt fish in barrels. So, along with fish, the Pomors need salt. If your options are limited at the moment, you can stop fishing and sell your salt to the other fishermen. If you correctly set the salt price, you will not only repair your broken ships but also get good earnings.

162777.name: Doppelgänger
162777.description:
"I'm telling you something isn't right..." whined the rogue.

"Shut it Tanlyn. And keep your mind on the quest before us. No more talk of 'seeing a doppelgänger.'" Bogrim the barbarian readied his great sword for the encounter ahead as the rest of the party drew close.

"This will not end well." Tanlyn replied. She kept her hand resting on the familiar weight of her dagger's pommel. Someone here was a traitor... if only she knew who.

Doppelgänger is a hidden role game designed by Steve Avery and Robert Burke. Each player takes the role of an intrepid adventurer who will help the group overcome great perils. However some among them are conniving doppelgängers who work against the party to bring their downfall.

Each turn the players confront a challenge requiring a combination of cards. The party leader selects which adventurers will help him win the encounter. Everyone selected contributes a card to the pool and one is added from the draw pile. Success brings rewards and moves the party closer to uncovering the hidden truth. Failure brings pain and moves the doppelgängers one step closer to victory.

Doppelgänger feels like a fast, co-operative dungeon delve, but with the added tension of significant distrust.

162778.name: Micro Arena
162778.description:
Micro Arena is a fantasy gladiatorial combat microgame. Each player creates a team of fantasy creatures and does battle to accumulate the most glory.

On each turn players choose one of eight actions specific to each creature. Then in initiative order, players reveal their selection and take their action. Every action has attack dice, defense number and a move rating along with a skill that allows the player to bend the the rules of the game.

Micro Arena is designed to be quick and fun using minimal components.

162779.name: Cities of Darkscorch
162779.description:
Cities of Darkscorch is a, decidedly adults-only, fever dream of a game in which players take on the role of ambitious rock bands, traveling from city to city and battling both the other players and a deck full of rival bands for supremacy. If a player can defeat a band in each of 16 cities, they can then move into the center city, and attempt to win one last battle to score a record contract, and win the game.

The band names and logos, printed onto the old-school wooden 45rpm record adapters that are used as the player pawns, the board, and the card art and text combine to portray a world out of the school notebook of some mid-1970's Led Zeppelin loving, Dungeons and Dragons obsessive teenager.

Players take turns moving around the board a number of spaces determined by the roll of a standard die, either fighting a band battle, rolling for movement again, or passing play depending on where they land. Each player holds a hand of five "Fate" cards, which might be one of four kinds of band members that can be played in front of the player, and persist from turn to turn; bonus cards that can help the player in battle; and cards that can be played to penalize other players. During a battle, the player draws a "Foe" card, representing a band they will battle, rolls a four-sided die to determine which band member will battle, and plays Fate cards to boost their chances. The result of the battle is found by rolling a twenty-sided die, plus whatever bonuses from the players own Fate cards, penalties from cards played by other players, versus a score on the Foe card. If the player wins the battle, they collect the "banner" for the city, tracked by each player on a card reminiscent of an auto-bingo card. Play passes around the table until a player collects all 16 of the banners, allowing them to finally enter the center city, "Numenor", and battle one last time in a bid for victory.

162780.name: Men of Honor
162780.description:
Men of Honor is a new generation skirmish wargame, a new 28mm miniatures game for 2 or more players controlling 2 factions that fight for the control of the city.

The modular game board allows to quickly set up the playing field in an exact and proportionate scale.
Measuring 90 x 90 cm (36 x 36”), it reproduces a part of a hypothetic north american city, with stores, shops, buildings, banks and much more.
In the box you will find 8 wonderful metal miniatures, so you can start immediately to play your first games in the fascinating Gangsters’ world!

162782.name: The Fancy Pants Adventures: World 3
162782.description:
The third installment of The Fancy Pants Adventures was released on April 5, 2012. A beta edition was available before release at bornegames.com for anyone to test out. There also is a new character in this game and new enemies. In this installment, Fancy Pants Man's little sister, Cutie Pants Girl, is kidnapped and Fancy Pants Man has to save her. Borne has released some art for the new game and asked followers of his site for feedback.

Some of the elements in World 3 are:
• Water-based levels and swimming.
• The little sister of Fancy Pants Man named Cutie Pants (who wears a dress) is introduced. She has the ability to swing from ceilings using her pet cat, Kitten Kabootle. It is unknown whether or not she will be able to swim.
• A longer, more complex plot involving pirates and ninjas.
• Pencil combat. Fancy Pants Man will employ a pencil as he does in Newgrounds Rumble. There are different ways of attacks: the pencil and the kick.
• Spin attack.
• Improved animation, backgrounds, and moves (eg. the character will no longer fall off of wall jumps, just slide).
• Special rooms where you perform a string of move combos for points.
• New enemies including angry ducks, frogs, parrots bats, pirates, and ninjas.
• Fancy Pants has a new ability to wall run.

Source: Wikipedia, "Fancy pants adventures", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

162783.name: Perplexing Puzzles #1: A Crystal Puzzle is Forever
162783.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kill! Loot! LEVEL!
Repeat as necessary.

It is a fact that we as gamers must face; a gaming campaign, at its heart, is an incredibly long corridor with monsters and shinies strewn throughout at regular intervals. GMs, DMs, Storytellers, and their ilk exist to mix this basic premise with interesting plothooks, puzzles, and homebrew mechanics. The end result, if done well, is a memorable bit of gaming whose highlights are talked about for years to come.

The primary issue with producing this memorable content is that pushing the concept of, "Kill! Loot! Level!" into the background is a ridiculously difficult feat to pull. Players are hardwired for it, some more than others. This means that anything that is meant to pull the player away from this concept must be designed to engage the player in an intriguing fashion and fire upon a part of the mind that is not satisfied by, "Kill! Loot! Level!" In other words, one must design in such a way that the player pushes, "Kill! Loot! Level!" away on his own because this new idea is THAT cool.

It is the author's opinion that puzzles are a fantastic method to accomplish this.

Perplexing Puzzles is a series of playtested, highly modular puzzles laid out in a logical fashion so that they may be read quickly and implanted into almost any campaign. Care has been taken to make these puzzles as system neutral as possible, but certain references to rules interactions in Dungeons and Dragons is unavoidable at times.

In this issue of Perplexing Puzzles

Chromatic Crystals

an extension of the classic “Lights Out” puzzles, featuring 4 colors rather than simply on/off and three modes of input

five pre-solved puzzles
three sets of variant rules, including a D&D 3.5 / The Pathfinder Roleplaying Game boss
a printout playmat with all the accoutrements

162784.name: Perplexing Puzzles #2: Puzzle Chests!
162784.description:
From publisher blurb:

What's inside the box?

Puzzles in tabletop RPGs tend to be enormous, on the scale of rooms, something that needs a dungeon, castle, or bank built around it in order for it to make sense. As such, most puzzles can't be poached from something you've already bought for use in the game you're playing now.

Originally part of the abandoned community project "Everything but the Monsters", Perplexing Puzzles #2: Puzzle Chests introduces treasure chests that are locked with a puzzle rather than by key. Small and portable, these puzzles can be plopped into a game wherever you feel like it!

Product Features

27 puzzle chests spread over 59 pages of content
Optional special rules that change the way a puzzle chest is played
Integrated traps that trigger when the players make a mistake
Flavorful standard and standard-and-a-half loot presented for all non-advanced chests
Advanced chests for players who want more of a challenge
New magic weapons and wondrous items
Plot hooks! Knowledge skill check lore regarding the rise and fall of a caricaturist, the kraken who once owned the world's largest flawless ruby, an emperor whose corpse was turned into wine, and the manufacture of ultramarine paint
Up to 16d6 (or a sheet or two of scratch paper) is required in order to play the largest puzzle chests

162785.name: The Carcass
162785.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Carcass is a roleplaying story game where players take on the roles of the last members of a dying post-apocalyptic tribe. The tribal leader is dead, the community in tatters, and the future a mystery. What will become of you in this barren wasteland?

The Carcass is played over the course of three to eight hours (or more). Each player takes on the role of a character vital to the tribe. Devoid of a leader, however, each character believes himself or herself most capable of keeping the tribe alive.

Players create two characters. One is a key figure in the community and the player’s main character. The other is an NPC member of the tribe of some influence. Beyond that, the tribe is made up of dozens of people who are just trying to survive.

The game revolves around unique action charts for each character role, instead of a system of narrow ‘moves’ defining the character options. Often player expectations focus on ‘winning,’ especially with such important goals created through character design. But the interesting actions in The Carcass are not about winning, but about dramatic results.

162786.name: Imperium Galacticum: HEX
162786.description:
Imperium Galacticum - HEX is a hex-tile based space civilization building strategy game for 2 or more players.

In IG HEX, each player assumes the role of a spacefaring, advanced civilization exploring space, discovering and colonizing planets, researching new technologies and waging interstellar war, with the goal of collecting 12 - 20 Victory Points (the number depends on how long a game players want to play).

Before the game can start, players build a playing field made up of hexagonal space tiles. As the game progresses, space hexes are explored, flipped face up that is and planets discovered my be colonized.

Players earn Victory Points for controlling planets (1 VP per planet they control) as well as for having the greatest total population on all their planets, the most powerful military, the highest research rate, the strongest fleet of spaceships and for having the largest territory.

After each round, Victory Points are calculated and the player who is first to reach 12 - 20 VP is declared the winner!

162789.name: Can You Escape
162789.description:
User Summary

A hidden object game where you must find the way out of each room via locating the objects and solving the puzzle by combining the found items in some way to create tools to assist you. The game has eight rooms to escape from.

162790.name: Can You Escape 2
162790.description:
User Summary

A hidden object game, sequel to the original Can You Escape. Players find objects hidden in a room you are trapped in and must combine them in a certain way to enable escape from the room. The game has eight rooms to play through.

162791.name: Can You Escape - Tower
162791.description:
User Summary

Hidden object game from the designer of the other Can You Escape games, with a medieval theme. You find objects hidden in the room and combine them in some way to create tools to aid your escape. The game has 18 rooms to play through.

162792.description:
When playing Hammered you take on the role of a group of fun-loving dwarves. You are all out on a pub-crawl and will be visiting a number of taverns during the night. However these are strange and often dangerous lands so it is best that you stay on your guard during your night out! There are Orcs and thieves and wizards about causing all manner of mischief and mayhem!

You start out with 15 gold coins and you must spend these when you first visit a tavern. There are 5 taverns in a game but each one has its own price and exit condition. This means that you could have a cheap night or an expensive one! There are challenge cards and chance cards, some that give you gold and others that take it away!

(1) In a turn you enter a tavern > pay for a drink > take an event card and follow its instruction > end your turn.
(2) On your following turns in a tavern you roll the die > if it matches the number on the tavern you exit and repeat (1)
(3) On your following turns in a tavern you roll the die > if you fail to match the number on the tavern you stay in the current tavern > take an event card and follow its instructions > end your turn.

If you run out of gold and you can't afford to pay at a tavern then you must steal gold until you have enough to continue, but don't get caught or you'll be kicked out and must go back to the previous tavern!

The aim of the game is to buy a drink in all of the taverns on the street and be the first player to leave the final tavern. However be warned that your fellow players can buy you a round if they can afford it and keep you in the final tavern a little longer!
162792.name: Hammered: The Card-Based Fantasy Pub-Crawl Drinking Game!

162793.name: Can You Escape - Adventure
162793.description:
User Summary

Hidden object game in the same vein as the other Can You Escape games. Players are trapped in a room and must locate items hidden around the scene via touch screen pressing. Some items can be combined to become tools that will assist your escape. The game has 15 'rooms' to escape from in a variety of settings with photographic-style backgrounds eg. a jungle or a warehouse.

162794.description:
Genpei Kassen (源平合戦) is part of the 'historical' division of Bandai's 'if' series of games. It is translated as 'Genpei War'. The 'Gen' is the Chinese pronunciation of the character for Minamoto, one of the two main combatants. 'Pei' (or 'Hei) similarly refers to the Taira, so it's the 'Minamoto-Taira War'. A strategic simulation of the 1180-1185 conflict in Japan involving the Minamoto and Taira warrior houses, it reflects the fact that fighting was not done strictly along 'clan' lines by including as other factions the Kiso (a branch of the Minamoto), the Fujiwara, and the Imperial Family. The war is still a popular subject in Japan today, being immortalized by period literature such as the Heike Monogatari ('Tale of the Heike') and live performances by blind biwa (lute) players.

The game is designed for 2-4 players taking the part of one of the four main combatants-the Taira (SW Japan), Kiso (a Minamoto branch, central Japan), Minamoto (SE Japan), and Fujiwara (N Japan). There are rules for a 5th player to operate abstractly as the Insei (retired Emperor) Go-Shirakawa, meddling with the plans of the four warrior houses. There are several different scenarios involving different numbers of players and levels of conquest. Gameplay features area movement of generic land and naval forces. Armies are generic and all have the same value, and are boosted by the values of leaders accompanying them. None of the leaders are named but each has a different skill level (if you're familiar with the history, it's easy to figure out the names that go with each leader counter). Naval warfare and sea movement of troops is somewhat abstract and confined to the southern areas of the map. Cardplay has a big effect on gameplay as cards can lead to possession of the Emperor, abundant crops, famine (denying victory points), access to independent naval forces, and other events. Victory is determined by both provinces held each turn (each province is worth a varying number of points) and enemy units destroyed.

Starting positions for the game are somewhat historically inaccurate; this was done for play balance as the Kiso are facing a two front war with the other combatants initially only having one. Factions are differentiated by their leader and naval pools. The Fujiwara have no navy, three overpoweringly wealthy provinces, and have the strongest leader in the game (and an extremely strong sub-leader). The Kiso have a middling leader, no navy, 23 relatively poor provinces, and a small pool of back up leaders. The Minamoto have a solid and large leadership pool but no navy and start with 14 provinces worth a moderate amount. The Taira have the misfortune of having an excellent leader being a subordinate of the worst leader in the game, but start off with naval forces and 20 moderately valuable provinces. There are also 3 neutral provinces that can be invaded during the game. Overall, the game has a good feel for the war it seeks to recreate and the difficulties faced by each faction.
162794.name: Genpei Kassen

162795.name: Hammered: The Shady Rogue Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Hammered: The Card-Based Fantasy Pub-Crawl Drinking Game!
162795.description:
This is an expansion for the game Hammered where you play as a group of dwarves on a pub-crawl. This expansion adds a shady underground style theme to the game with a new character, a new tavern and a number of event cards that give the core game a sense that there is a seedy underbelly to these quaint taverns!

The game-play is the same however the expansion adds some additional rules by giving the new character a perk, the new tavern a house rule and a couple of cards that allow other players to acquire the new perk as well. This particular perk allows players to get gold even when they lose wagers and to pay less for drinks in the new tavern, everyone else has to pay extortionate prices!

162796.name: Hammered: The Alchemist's Mark Expansion
boardgameexpansion: Hammered: The Card-Based Fantasy Pub-Crawl Drinking Game!
162796.description:
This is an expansion for the game 'Hammered' where you play as a group of dwarves on a pub-crawl. This expansion adds a magical theme to the core game with a new character, new tavern and wizard themed event cards.

The game plays the same however the addition of this expansion throws in some new rules. The new character has a perk, the new tavern has a house rule and there are a couple of cards that allow other players to acquire the perk as well. The tavern's house rule makes gold lost or spent inside the tavern turn into other commodities and the perk allows players to spend gold in order to make other players forfeit! There is also an additional rule that only comes into play if the card is drawn which makes the winner of the game perform a challenge before they can be crowned victorious!

162797.name: Doctor Who: The Gunpowder Plot
162797.description:
The TARDIS lands in London, 1605, encountering a group of men who are plotting to assassinate the Head of State. The Doctor, Amy and Rory realise they are at a pivotal point in time but so are two alien races, both of which are more than happy to change history to suit their own ends...

Source: The Game Website.

162798.name: Dem Gems
162798.description:
Dem Gems is a quick play micro game and the theme of Dem Gems is rather abstract, you're collecting gems in a stoney looking labyrinth as a small coloured cylinder.... Basically you are there to collect as many gems as possible in an ever changing maze while you try to avoid holes, bombs and other players.

The cards are narrow domino cards which are first shuffled and then 8 of them are laid out face up to make a 4 x 4 square board. The remaining cards are then dealt out equally face down to the players, any remaining cards are put to one side. Each player puts their piece at a corner (not on the board yet) and rolls the die to determine who goes first.
You roll the die and you MUST move your piece that number of spaces even if it means losing gems! After you have moved you then place one of your cards from your hand onto the board to change the layout. This can be to your advantage or to sabotage another player.

Keep track of your scores with a notepad and pen to make it easier and once all players have played their cards and had an equal number of turns you count up the scores. The player with the highest score wins.
